subs.text: When I was a kid, Isaac Asimov made science fiction publishing seem like the most exciting industry in the world. I'm incredibly delighted to be able to pre-announce another volume of original Jewish science fiction, from the same editorial team that produced Other Covenants. [link]
subs.rawText:
When I was a kid, Isaac Asimov made science fiction publishing seem like the most exciting industry in the world. 

I'm incredibly delighted to be able to pre-announce another volume of original Jewish science fiction, from the same editorial team that produced Other Covenants. https://t.co/Oq1fMlaPsn

subs.text: A formal announcement and call for submissions will wait until 2023, but you can find the tentative title and subtitle on the Other Covenants Kickstarter page. [link]
subs.rawText: A formal announcement and call for submissions will wait until 2023, but you can find the tentative title and subtitle on the Other Covenants Kickstarter page. https://t.co/VNbsvhGJMr

subs.text: And despite the trials and tribulations that made their  crazy dream of "an alternate Jewish history anthology" take far longer than expected, @AD_Lobel  and @MarkShainblum are eager to create Jewish publishing history yet again. I couldn't be more excited to help them.
subs.rawText: And despite the trials and tribulations that made their  crazy dream of "an alternate Jewish history anthology" take far longer than expected, @AD_Lobel  and @MarkShainblum are eager to create Jewish publishing history yet again. I couldn't be more excited to help them.

subs.text: Clearly the fourth prime minister of Israel did not support time travel as part of Israel’s nonconventional arsenal – at least not publicly.

subs.text: @joshtpm But: Weren’t those boxes material that the Archives was expecting? In other words, documents that had already been cataloged? Which means these would be specific documents known by name and not by content?
subs.rawText: @joshtpm But: Weren’t those boxes material that the Archives was expecting? In other words, documents that had already been cataloged? Which means these would be specific documents known by name and not by content?

subs.text: @joshtpm Which is to say, not plans for stealth fighters, but documents generated in the course of ordinary business (and automatically named) but not yet archived?
subs.rawText: @joshtpm Which is to say, not plans for stealth fighters, but documents generated in the course of ordinary business (and automatically named) but not yet archived?

subs.text: @joshtpm If that is the case — and I could well be misremembering the facts of the Archives reporting — documents from 1/6 would fit the bill.
